Drawing

Interface VisibleObject

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Maze, MovableBox, Particle, Player, PowerUp, SkyBox

    public interface VisibleObject
    VisibleObject is the interface for all classes that have to be displayed on screen.

    All the objects that have to be displayed on the screen, should implement this interface. This forces the developer to implement all methods that are defined in this interface in the class, else the code will not compile.

    Author:
    Bruno Scheele

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void display(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
      display(GL) contains all the GL callback functions to display the object on the screen.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        void display(javax.media.opengl.GL gl)
        display(GL) contains all the GL callback functions to display the object on the screen.

        The OpenGL functions can be accessed through the GL context, for example:

        • gl.glBegin( GL.GL_QUADS );
        • gl.glVertex3d( 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 );
        • gl.glEnd();
        Note that both the functions as the GL static variables are called through gl. Because the static variables should be called in a static way, we type GL in caps then, like GL.GL_QUADS.
        Parameters:
        gl - the GL context in which will be drawn
